Comment 2: 
I believe it is defined because in the section on short variable declarations it says:

(A short variable declaration) "... is a shorthand for a regular variable declaration
with initializer expressions but no types..."

Thus, a short variable declaration is simply syntactic sugar and can be replaced with a
regular variable declaration (except for uses in init statements, but naturally the same
principle applies), and then the same scoping rules as for regular variable declarations
apply.

Perhaps adding a clarifying sentence to that effect makes sense, but I am not convinced
it is necessary.
